sentences.sContent: I took a bus to San Francisco.
sentences.sCn: 我乘公共汽车去旧金山。

sentences.sContent: Buses run at 15 and 30 minutes past the hour.
sentences.sCn: 公共汽车在每小时的15分和30分时发车。

sentences.sContent: ...The man in the Google vehicle reported that he assumed the bus would slow down to let the car out...
...our test driver believed the bus was going to slow or stop to allow us to merge into the traffic...
...One of Google's self-driving cars crashed into a bus in California last month...
...but you can take a bus from Vancouver back to Bellingham and still save money...
...Has the mechanic called the bus repairers...
...I often cried on the bus on the way back from work...
...This crazy bus schedule has got me completely confused...
...I can’t figure out when my bus to Cleveland leaves...
...and bus shelters for advertising is an effective way of reaching these on-the-go consumers...

phrases.pCn: 班车（在较短距离之间往返的交通车）；豪华轿车
城市客车；市区公共汽车
在公共汽车站，在公交车站

trans.tranOther: a large vehicle that people pay to travel on
